options.text: We made a bootstrap starting point so you can hit the ground running.

Services widgets are designed to showcase blocks of content with an icon on top. You can select any icon from the FontAwsome  v.4.4.0 and apply all the configurations it supports (icon size, animation and rotation). Further more Services widgets can be configured to display Read more buttons. Buttons can be configured for any Bootstrap option ( size, color and width). Width of these widgets can be set to 1/1. 1/2, 1/3 and 1/4 width of the container. Below are examples with various combinations.

Biography widget is designed to display team members. They are added as articles and featured image of an article is used for the team member photo. Bootstrap classes for the shape of the image can be applied (default, circle or rounded). Besides biography and wether or not to display the photograph, in this widget you can add the Position in the team, links to social media profiles and icon size. Widget width can be configured to 1/1, 1/2, 1/3 and 1/4 of the container. Below are examples with various combinations.

Pricing columns are designed to display various pricing plans. Configuration options you have a t your disposal are: name of the plan, price, unit, button styling and list of features. Also you can highlight column as featured to have the inverted header color applied. Widget width can be configured to 1/1, 1/2, 1/3 and 1/4 of the container. Below are examples with various combinations.

Gallery widget is designed to display unroole galleries. Apart from selecting the gallery to display, you have the option to choose the width of container (Bootstraps fixed or fluid container) and width of images in Bootstrap columns for each breakpoint. Also you have the option to choose wether or not to display the caption of each image. Below are examples with various combinations.

Article collection widget displays unroole articles based on category and/or type you select and number of articles to show. Apart from these default options you can choose to display meta data for each article (author, published date and category), featured image, pagination and type of pagination (simple or numbered) and number of characters of the article body. In terms of layout you can choose the width of the container (Bootstraps fluid or fixed container). Below are examples with various combinations.

Article widget displays single unroole article. Configuration options you have at your disposal are displaying featured image, category, published date and author. Also you can display related articles section, which will display last 4 articles in the same category. In terms of layout you can choose the width of the container (Bootstraps fluid or fixed container). Below are examples with various combinations.

Event Collection widget displays unroole events based on category and/or location you select and number of events to show. Apart from these default options you can choose to display meta data for each event (location, start and end time), featured image, pagination and type of pagination (simple or numbered) and number of characters of the article body. In terms of layout you can choose the width of the container (Bootstraps fluid or fixed container). Below are examples with various combinations.

Event widget displays single unroole event. Configuration options you have at your disposal are displaying featured image and category. Also you can display related events based on category or location, which will display last 4 events. Every event has a Google map with marker and location details. You can set the level of zoom for the map, displaying default Google Maps UI controls, and scroll to zoom functionality. In order for maps to load you will need to add your own Google Maps API Key to the Google Maps API widget. In terms of layout you can choose the width of the container (Bootstraps fluid or fixed container).

Maps can be displayed as standalone components. Each map is created with Map Wrapper widget and each marker with Map Marker widget placed inside the Map Wrapper. Map Wrapper widget can be configured to set the level of zoom for the map, displaying default Google Maps UI controls, and scroll to zoom functionality. Map Markers are configured by adding latitude and longitude, name and description, which will be displayed in the info window when marker is clicked. In order for maps to load you will need to add your own Google Maps API Key to the Google Maps API widget. Similar to maps, forms are built with Form Wrapper and Form Field widgets. In the Form Wrapper you can enter the title of the form and add method and action url to be used for processing the form. Also you can set Bootstraps form orientation (default, inline or horizontal). Form field widget gives you option to choose type of the input field, label and placeholder text. In terms of layout these widgets don't have set widths and will take entire width of the Column widget they are placed in.

Slideshow widget displays unroole gallery in Bootstraps Carousel component. Besides choosing the gallery, you can configure all default Bootstrap options, loop, auto slide in milliseconds, keyboard control and caption. In terms of layout you can choose the width of the container (Bootstraps fluid or fixed container)
Column widget is used to build Bootstraps grid system. Each column can be configured by number of columns for each break point. Below are various examples.

Button widget is used to display Bootstraps predefined buttons. Besides default colors, sizes and width, you can choose tag (link, button or submit) url or unroole page, and label of the button. Also you can place Font Awesome icon next to the label. Below are examples of various options.
